aria_content_in_landmark.0: All content must reside within an element with a landmark role
aria_content_in_landmark.Fail_1: Content is not within a landmark element

style_color_misuse.0: Combine color and descriptive markup to convey information
style_color_misuse.Potential_1: Verify color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information

element_id_unique.0: Element 'id' attribute values must be unique within a document
element_id_unique.potential_in_use: The <{0}> element has the id "{1}" that is already in use

aria_keyboard_handler_exists.0: Interactive WAI_ARIA UI components must provide keyboard access
aria_keyboard_handler_exists.potential_no_keyboard_access: Verify the <{0}> element with "{1}" role has keyboard access

aria_region_labelled.0: Each element with "region" role must have a label that describes its purpose
aria_region_labelled.Fail_1: Element with "region" role does not have a label

element_tabbable_unobscured.0: When an element receives focus, it is not entirely covered by other content
element_tabbable_unobscured.potential_obscured: Confirm that when the element receives focus, it is not covered or, if covered by user action, can be uncovered without moving focus

style_focus_visible.0: The keyboard focus indicator should be visible when default border or outline is modified by CSS
style_focus_visible.potential_focus_not_visible: Check the keyboard focus indicator is visible when using CSS declaration for 'border' or 'outline'

target_spacing_sufficient.0: The target must be sufficiently sized or spaced from other targets
target_spacing_sufficient.violation_spacing: Undersized target "{0}" does not have sufficient spacing of 12 CSS pixels from another target "{1}"

widget_tabbable_single.0: Components with a widget role must have no more than one tabbable element
widget_tabbable_single.potential_multiple_tabbable: Component with "{0}" role has more than one tabbable element

input_label_visible.0: An input element must have an associated visible label
input_label_visible.potential_no_label: The input element does not have an associated visible label

aria_descendant_valid.0: Browsers ignore the explicit and implicit ARIA roles of the descendants of certain elements
aria_descendant_valid.potential_child_implicit_role: The element with role "{0}" contains descendants with implicit roles "{1}" which are ignored by browsers

text_contrast_sufficient.0: The contrast ratio of text with its background must meet WCAG AA requirements
text_contrast_sufficient.potential_graphic_background: Verify the contrast ratio of the text against the lightest and the darkest colors of the background meets the WCAG AA minimum requirements for text of size {1}px and weight of {2}
text_contrast_sufficient.potential_same_color: The foreground text and its background color are both detected as {3}. Verify the text meets the WCAG AA requirements for minimum contrast
text_contrast_sufficient.potential_text_shadow: Verify the contrast ratio of the text with shadow meets the WCAG AA minimum requirements for text of size {1}px and weight of {2}

aria_form_label_unique.0: Each element with "form" role must have a unique label that describes its purpose
aria_form_label_unique.fail_label_not_unique: Multiple elements with "form" role do not have unique labels

caption_track_exists.0: A <video> element must have a text alternative for any meaningful audio content
caption_track_exists.Potential_1: Verify that captions are available for any meaningful audio or provide a caption track for the <video> element

svg_graphics_labelled.0: A non-decorative SVG element must have an accessible name
svg_graphics_labelled.fail_acc_name: The SVG element has no accessible name

text_block_heading.0: Heading text should use a heading element or role
text_block_heading.potential_heading: Confirm this text '{0}' is used as a heading and if so, modify to use a heading element or role

blockquote_cite_exists.0: Use <blockquote> only for quotations, not indentation
blockquote_cite_exists.Potential_1: Verify that <blockquote> should have a 'cite' attribute and not be used for indentation only

text_sensory_misuse.0: Instructions should be meaningful without relying solely on shape, size, or location words
text_sensory_misuse.potential_other: Confirm the user instruction is still understandable without the word(s) '{0}'
